cardinfo.CI: Pterospermum - Kanak Champa Tree/Kanak Champa Tree - Canopy.jpg

V: Pterospermum is a genus of tropical trees and shrubs belonging to the family Sterculiaceae. Some species are grown ornamentally while others are valued for their timber. Kanak Champa is a tree of Indian origin, which reaches a height of 50-70 ft. Leaves are simple, alternate, have stipules and are palmately ribbed. It has large fragrant nocturnal white flowers, occuring in axillary fascicles. Fruit is a capsule, angled and furfuraceaous. This plant is seen only in cultivation. It yields a reddish wood used for planking; often grown as an ornamental or shade tree.

Common: Dinner plate tree, Maple-leaved bayur tree
Assamese: Moragos
Bengali: Muskanda
Hindi: Kanak champa, Muchkand, Muchkund, मचकुंद पेड़, कनक चम्पा
Malayalam: Malanjutali, Cerukonna, മലന്തുടലി, ചെറുകൊന്ന
Manipuri: Kwakla
Marathi: Karnikar
Odiya: Mushukundo
Tamil: Vennangu, வெண்ணங்கு மரம்
Telugu: Matsakanda
